newsitem.title: USA: American, pilots to talk into today or tomorrow - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: American, pilots to talk into today or tomorrow - WSJ.

text.p: Contract negotiations between American Airlines and its pilots' union would likely continue through Monday or Tuesday on an island off the coast of Washington state, the Wall Street Journal said in its electronic edition on Monday.
Negotiations were held on Orcas Island, located in the Puget Sound about 85 miles north of Seattle, the paper said.
The paper said the continuation of talks, headed by Presidential Emergency Board chairman Robert Harris, might be seen as a sign of progress.
After the first two days, a person close to the situation was quoted in the paper as saying talks on the island had made little progress.
American Airlines, a unit of AMR Corp, has been negotiating with its 9,300 pilots over a new contract.
